As Chair of the Texas Democratic Congressional Delegation, I thank @RepEscobar for her leadership and ability to bring us together for this rare bipartisan delegation to the US-Mexico border in El Paso. She has truly made a difference and I believe she will continue to do so.
We must take care of these children.
We have a moral imperative to do what we can for these children. If we allow them to become objects, things that we can just push around, toss aside, we will not be the country we claim to be.
Have we lost our sense of direction? Do we not understand the humanity we are desecrating when we do this? A six-year-old baby, and she was not the youngest child at the facility.
Today, at an El Paso border facility, tears welled in the eyes of my colleagues and I as a six-year-old baby cried and pled to her eight-year-old brother, refusing to let him go.

We treat our neighbors at the southern border as part of the labor force. 

We treat our neighbors at the northern border as economic partners. 

We must treat our neighbors at the southern border the same as we treat our neighbors at the northern border.
